p: As plant communities are not necessary to linearly respond to environmental changes 57, generalized additive models (GAM) were induced to cope with problems such as collinearity and non-linearity between responsible and explanatory variables 58 using the mgcv package in R 59. Here, abiotic explanatory variables include site geographical locations (longitude, latitude, and altitude), climatic factors (GSP, AccT and HMI) and soil properties (SOC, STN and C: N ratio). The response variables were ANPP and PUE at the plot level. We followed a backward selection approach with Akaike Information Criterion (AIC) and Bayesian Information Criteria (BIC) to find the optimal models out 58 60 ( Supplementary Figures S1 and S2 and Tables S2 and S3).
